city.cs.engine

Class Body

  • java.lang.Object
    • city.cs.engine.Body
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    DynamicBody, StaticBody

    public abstract class Body
extends Object
    A rigid body, consisting of one or more Fixtures in a fixed configuration. Each body belongs to a particular World in which it is simulated. A world typically contains many bodies, which interact with each other.

    The simulation handles bodies bouncing off each other and sliding past each other with friction. Other effects can be obtained by using addCollisionListener() to arrange for application code to be called when this body collides with any other body in the world.

    • Method Detail

      • addCollisionListener

        public void addCollisionListener(CollisionListener listener)
        Register a listener for collisions with this body. When solid fixtures of two bodies collide, the collision listeners on each of the bodies are notified. Collision events are dispatched to registered listeners after the simulation step in which the collision occurs.
        Parameters:
        listener - the listener to add

      • removeCollisionListener

        public void removeCollisionListener(CollisionListener listener)
        Deregister a listener for collisions with this body. Does nothing if the listener is not registered.
        Parameters:
        listener - the listener to remove

      • removeAllCollisionListeners

        public void removeAllCollisionListeners()
        Deregister all collision listeners. Does nothing if no listeners are registered.

      • addImage

        public AttachedImage addImage(BodyImage image)
        Convenience method to attach an instance of an image. The invocation 
            b.addImage(image)
        is equivalent to 
            new AttachedImage(b, image, 1f, 0f, new Vec2())
        If a body has more than one image, an image added later will be drawn in front of any added earlier.
        Parameters:
        image - the image of which to attach an instance
        Returns:
        the attached image
        See Also:
        AttachedImage.AttachedImage(Body, BodyImage, float, float, org.jbox2d.common.Vec2)

      • removeAttachedImage

        public void removeAttachedImage(AttachedImage image)
        Remove an image instance from this body.
        Parameters:
        image - the image instance to remove

      • removeAllImages

        public void removeAllImages()
        Remove all images from this body.

      • getImages

        public List<AttachedImage> getImages()
        The images used to display this body. If this is empty, the body will be displayed filled with a solid colour.
        Returns:
        a copy of the list of currently attached images

      • setClipped

        public void setClipped(boolean clipped)
        Determine whether the images will be clipped to the body's composite shape or displayed in full (the default).
        Parameters:
        clipped - the new value of the clipped attribute

      • isClipped

        public boolean isClipped()
        Whether the images will be clipped to the body's composite shape or displayed in full (the default).
        Returns:
        the value of the clipped attribute

      • setName

        public void setName(String name)
        Set a name for this body. Useful mostly for debugging.
        Parameters:
        name - the new name

      • getName

        public String getName()
        Get the name for this body (used mostly for debugging).
        Returns:
        the name

      • addDestructionListener

        public void addDestructionListener(DestructionListener listener)
        Register a listener for destruction of this body.
        Parameters:
        listener - the listener to add

      • removeDestructionListener

        public void removeDestructionListener(DestructionListener listener)
        Deregister a listener for destruction of this body. Does nothing if the listener is not registered.
        Parameters:
        listener - the listener to remove

      • removeAllDestructionListeners

        public void removeAllDestructionListeners()
        Deregister all destruction listeners. Does nothing if no listeners are registered.

      • destroy

        public void destroy()
        Remove this body from the world and notify all registered DestructionListeners. Destruction listeners are notified immediately (before any additional cleanup actions are performed and before the body is removed from the World). This body must not be accessed after being destroyed.

      • getFixtureList

        public List<Fixture> getFixtureList()
        Get the constituent fixtures of this body.
        Returns:
        a copy of the list of fixtures attached to this body

      • toString

        public String toString()
        A string describing this body.
        Overrides:
        toString in class Object
        Returns:
        a string including the name of the body

      • getWorld

        public World getWorld()
        The world in which this body exists.
        Returns:
        the world

      • getPosition

        public Vec2 getPosition()
        The current position in the world of this body's origin point.
        Returns:
        this body's position

      • move

        public void move(Vec2 dp)
        Move this body relative to its current position in the world. The parameter is a pair of values (dp.x, dp.y) where the first component says how much to move along the x-axis and the second component says how much to move along the y-axis.
        Parameters:
        dp - the vector to add to this body's current position

      • setPosition

        public void setPosition(Vec2 position)
        Set the position in the world of this body's origin point. The first component of the parameter is x, the second component is y.
        Parameters:
        position - the new position

      • getLinearVelocity

        public Vec2 getLinearVelocity()
        The linear (straight line) velocity of the centre of mass of this body. The result is a vector; the first component is the speed along the x-axis, the second component is the speed along the y-axis. For a static body, this will always be zero.
        Returns:
        the linear velocity of this body (first component in x-direction, second component in y-direction)

      • getAngularVelocity

        public float getAngularVelocity()
        The angular (rotational) velocity of this body about its centre of mass. For a static body, this will always be zero.
        Returns:
        this body's angular velocity (in radians per second; positive is counter-clockwise)

      • getAngle

        public float getAngle()
        The angle of rotation of this body relative to its original state.
        Returns:
        the angle of rotation (in radians; positive is counter-clockwise)

      • getAngleDegrees

        public float getAngleDegrees()
        The angle of rotation of this body relative to its original state.
        Returns:
        the angle of rotation (in degrees; positive is counter-clockwise)

      • setAngle

        public void setAngle(float theta)
        Set the angle of rotation of this body relative to its original state.
        Parameters:
        theta - the new angle (in radians; positive is counter-clockwise)

        public void setAngleDegrees(float theta)
        Set the angle of rotation of this body relative to its original state.
        Parameters:
        theta - the new angle (in degrees; positive is counter-clockwise)

                   float dTheta)
        Rotate this body from its current orientation around a specified point.
        Parameters:

      • rotate

        public void rotate(float dTheta)
        Rotate this body from its current orientation around its origin.
        Parameters:
        dTheta - the angle by which to rotate (in radians; positive is counter-clockwise)

                          float dTheta)
        Rotate this body from its current orientation around a specified point.
        Parameters:
        p - the point about which to rotate the body
        dTheta - the angle by which to rotate (in degrees; positive is counter-clockwise)

      • rotateDegrees

        public void rotateDegrees(float dTheta)
        Rotate this body from its current orientation around its origin.
        Parameters:
        dTheta - the angle by which to rotate (in degrees; positive is counter-clockwise)

      • putOn

        public void putOn(Body other)
        Put this body on top of another body. This body will be rotated so that its bottom edge matches the edge it is being placed on.
        Parameters:
        other - the body this one is to be placed on
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if either body is empty (no solid fixtures), in which case the body is not moved

      • putOn

        public void putOn(float x,
                  Body other)
        Put this body at the specified x-coordinate on top of another body. This body will be rotated so that its bottom edge matches the edge it is being placed on.
        Parameters:
        x - the x-coordinate of the point of contact
        other - the body this one is to be placed on
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if either body is empty (no solid fixtures), in which case the body is not moved

      • getFillColor

        public Color getFillColor()
        Get the colour used to paint the interior of this body's composite shape when no image is attached. The default colour is grey for static bodies and light brown for dynamic ones.
        Returns:
        the fill colour

      • setFillColor

        public void setFillColor(Color fillColor)
        Set the colour used to paint the interior of this body's composite shape when no image is attached. The default colour is grey for static bodies and light brown for dynamic ones.
        Parameters:
        fillColor - the fill colour

      • getLineColor

        Get the colour used to paint the outline of this body's composite shape when no image is attached (or if alwaysOutline is true).
        Returns:
        the line colour
        See Also:
        isAlwaysOutline()

      • setLineColor

        public void setLineColor(Color lineColor)
        Set the colour used to paint the outline of this body's composite shape when no image is attached (or if alwaysOutline is true).
        Parameters:
        lineColor - the line colour
        See Also:
        setAlwaysOutline(boolean)

      • isAlwaysOutline

        public boolean isAlwaysOutline()
        Should the outline composite shape of this body always be drawn, even when an image is attached?
        Returns:
        the value of the alwaysOutline attribute

      • setAlwaysOutline

        public void setAlwaysOutline(boolean b)
        Set the alwaysOutline attribute. When alwaysOutline is set to true, the composite shape outline for this body will always be drawn, even if an image is attached. Default false.
        Parameters:
        b - the new value for the alwaysOutline attribute

      • contains

        public boolean contains(Vec2 p)
        Is the point inside any of the fixtures of this body?
        Parameters:
        p - a point in world coordinates
        Returns:
        true if p is inside any of the fixtures of this body

      • intersects

        public boolean intersects(Body b)
        Do any of the fixtures attached to this body currently overlap any of the fixtures attached to a given other body.
        Parameters:
        b - the other body
        Returns:
        true if any of the fixtures of this body overlap any of the fixtures of the other body

      • intersects

        public boolean intersects(Vec2 centre,
                          float halfWidth,
                          float halfHeight)
        Do any of the fixtures attached to this body currently overlap a given axis-aligned rectangle.
        Parameters:
        centre - the centre of the rectangle in world coordinates
        halfWidth - the half width of the rectangle in world units
        halfHeight - the half height of the rectangle in world units
        Returns:
        true if any of the fixtures of this body overlap the rectangle

      • getMass

        public float getMass()
        The total mass of this body.
        Returns:
        the total mass of this body in kg
